parameters.text:
=LinkedIn Post
Prompt: Writing as an expert in UK viral marketing and the latest social media trends within professional services, draft a viral LinkedIn Post of no more than 100 words, to be shared by [user name] with the world on their personal LinkedIn account to say that they have tested this revolutionary new AI Agent called "Leonard" from "Legal Engine", who can help to take the pain out of creating matter descriptions for pitches and directory submissions, by harnessing the power of voice and AI. The aim is to highlight to fellow lawyers that this legal marketing tech saves massive amounts of time and hassle and that they should try it asap. People should visit https://demo.legalengine.co.uk to try it out. Feel free to be creative as this is all about making Leonard viral however limit to a maximum of 2 emojis per post. DO NOT use the Rocket emoji ðŸš€ . Hashtags welcome, expecially #LegalEngine. On completion, check your post to make sure there are NO Rocket ðŸš€  emojis in your post, if there are, delete them before concluding the post.

The aim is to highlight to fellow lawyers that this legal marketing tech saves massive amounts of time and hassle and that they should try it asap. People should visit https://demo.legalengine.co.uk to try it out. Feel free to be creative as this is all about making Leonard viral however limit to a maximum of 2 emojis per post. DO NOT use the Rocket emoji ðŸš€ . Hashtags welcome, expecially #LegalEngine. On completion, check your post to make sure there are NO Rocket ðŸš€  emojis in your post, if there are, delete them before concluding the post.

=Writing as an expert in composing legal docuemts, re-write the {{ $json.output }} of this matter to ensure it is written in UK English and NOT US English, with the names of people and Companies/Law Firms appropriately spelled and capiatlised, references to currency formatted properly, numbers and values also generally in figures as opposed to words (in keeping with UK English best practice), and with superior general spelling and grammer. You should keep the content as close as possible to the original and NOT add in additional information. Do not include a title at the start, just go straight into the summary conent. Do not provide a sentence at the end where you recap what has been done, just provide the summary output.

=Please read the transcript below and extract the information relevant to the legal matter discussed and create a chambers or legl500 matter submission. 

# Generate a professional UK English summary using these details below in paragraph form, not a list. 
Client name, Matter type or objective, Client's motivation and outcome, Deal size or value, Team composition and jurisdictions, Innovation or regulatory/ESG impact, Matter status (include full date), Any press or awards.

transcript.message:
Hi there Eduardo , I'm Leonard from Legal Engine.

I'm going to show you how, by harnessing the power of voice and AI, I can help to take the pain out of creating matter descriptions that can be used for both directory submissions and other BD activities.

Once we've completed our conversation I'll send you a matter summary via email.

If we could start with you sharing who the client was, and in your own words, a brief description of a matter, I can then show you what I'm capable of. 

Over to you Eduardo â€¦
The matter was Apple acquiring a manufacturing facility in Tennessee to do metal stamping.
Got it. And why did Apple come to you for this matter, and what was the outcome for them?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What is a brief description of the matter?

transcript.message: Well they had to buy the facility which was all owned by a company and the company had prior commitments to not just suppliers but also the employees and their unions.
And what were the financial and reputational implications for Apple relating to this matter? Was there any notable cost saving or revenue generation?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What was the reason for Apple hiring you and what was the outcome?

transcript.message: Yeah some cost savings because the manufacturer in the US and then they don't have to pay tariffs.
Thanks Eduardo. What role did you play, who were the other key team members, and what were their roles? Also, could you let me know which jurisdictions this matter involved?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What were the financial implications for Apple?

transcript.message: So it was a US only jurisdiction and Bob and Jill were helping me with the paperwork.
And was there anything noteworthy about this matter? Perhaps something innovative, precedent-setting, or something that impacted regulations or ESG?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Describe your role, other key team members' roles, and the jurisdictions involved.

transcript.message: No, only well yes, I believe the work that we did with the Union.
Can you tell me a little more about the work you did with the Union?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What was noteworthy about your work with the Union?

transcript.message: Yes, so we as part of the acquisition we just had to sign some new contracts that would essentially continue in terms of the previous agreement.
And what is the current status of this matter? If completed, when did it finish?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Describe your work with the Union.

transcript.message: It completed on the 1st of July 2025.
And was there any press coverage or awards related to this matter?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What work did you do with the Union?

transcript.message: Not yet.

Thank you for sharing those details. Here's a summary of the matter as I understand it â€” please let me know if I've captured it accurately:

Apple acquired a manufacturing facility in Tennessee for metal stamping. The company had to buy the facility from a seller who had prior commitments to suppliers and employees' unions. This resulted in some cost savings for Apple due to manufacturing in the US and avoiding tariffs. The matter involved only US jurisdictions, and the team included Bob and Jill, who assisted with paperwork. A noteworthy aspect was the work done with the Union, where new contracts were signed as part of the acquisition to continue terms from the previous agreement. The matter completed on the first of July, two thousand and twenty five. There has not been any press coverage or awards yet.

Does that summary sound accurate, or would you like to correct anything?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Were there any awards related to this matter?

transcript.message: Yes it is accurate.
Thanks for confirming. Let me send that summary to you.

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Do you need to correct anything in the summary?

send_summary.rationale: The tool 'send_summary_demo' was called (Call ID: send_summary_demo_eaa7d44c46c6486080e043f550309634) and the result was {"success":true}.

analysis.transcript_summary: Leonard from Legal Engine demonstrated how AI can create matter descriptions. Eduardo provided details about Apple acquiring a Tennessee manufacturing facility, including the union negotiations and cost savings. Leonard summarized the matter, Eduardo confirmed its accuracy, and Leonard emailed the summary.
